hero.subtitle: The intelligent mobile robot prototype for sustainable industrial automation.
hero.school: A project by the IIS Torricelli team in Milan.

vision.title: Project Vision
vision.p1: AUTOSTOKER was conceived as an experimental solution for production and logistics environments, capable of supporting operational activities such as object handling, process assistance, and environmental monitoring.
vision.p2: The entire system was created with the goal of demonstrating concretely how robotics, energy efficiency, and software-hardware integration can converge into a modular and scalable technological platform, following a multidisciplinary engineering approach.

architecture.title: Mechanical and Structural Architecture
architecture.desc: Structurally, the robot adopts an innovative architecture based on two independent mobile limbs (legs). This solution was chosen to optimize mass distribution and dynamic stability.
architecture.bodyDesc: Constitutes the load-bearing structural torso, rigidly integrated with the main frame. It houses the electronic, sensory, and energy modules, configured to ensure maximum component protection and optimal weight balance.
architecture.manipulationDesc: For gripping operations, AUTOSTOKER uses a mechanism consisting of two opposed linear arms. This solution ensures uniform force on the object, structural robustness, and superior energy efficiency compared to complex articulated systems.

locomotion.title: Advanced Locomotion System
locomotion.desc1: The movement system is the technological heart of the prototype.
locomotion.desc2: Each "foot" of the robot integrates a set of two wheels with split functions:
locomotion.frontDesc: Dedicated exclusively to direction. Being traction-free, it allows millimeter precision in maneuvers and drastically reduces friction during trajectory changes.
locomotion.rearDesc: Dedicated exclusively to thrust and driving force. This hybrid configuration allows superior dynamic control, avoiding slippage and optimizing energy consumption when moving heavy loads.

sustainability.title: Sustainability and Industry 5.0
sustainability.desc: Special attention has been paid to environmental impact and efficiency:
sustainability.materialsDesc: The structure and mechanical components are designed for additive manufacturing (3D printing) using recycled plastic materials.
sustainability.energyDesc: The system integrates rechargeable batteries supported by solar modules and a Kinetic Energy Recovery System (KERS) during deceleration phases, reducing energy waste in the operational cycle.

software.title: Software Architecture and Control
software.desc: The robot's intelligence coordinately manages locomotion and sensors through three operational modes:
software.remoteDesc: For manual emergency or precision maneuvers.
software.autoDesc: Based on intelligent algorithms for autonomous navigation.
software.webDesc: For constant monitoring, parameter configuration, and operational security against unauthorized commands.

team.title: Development Team Roles
team.danieleBio: Passionate about 3D design and robotics, he is responsible for transforming ideas into solid physical components, optimizing masses for the AUTOSTOKER platform.
team.manuelBio: The logical mind of the group, programming the applications for robot control. He also programs the management system and the website, handling the communicative side of the project.
team.lorenzoBio: Circuit specialist, acts as a vital bridge between the robot's mechanics and the code, managing the complex sensors and energy management.
